intro: Gymnostoma, commonly known as the common marsh orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a perennial herbaceous plant that typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes and bogs. The plant features a slender, upright stem with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually greenish-yellow with a distinctive hooded labellum. Gymnostoma plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by contributing to biodiversity and soil stabilization.
